channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023080081
item.description:
Report X-2023080081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being unloaded when it slipped out of a package handler hands. making it land upside down causing the lid to become loose and leak. Hazmat was then placed in a red tote lined with a hazmat bag and brought to QA for proper processing. DescribePack: The cap on the nitric acid easily loosens, causing it to leak and wet the side of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was put in a yellow drum and lined with a hazmat bag to prevent any leaks from happening.

item.title: Report E-2023070932
item.description:
Report E-2023070932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-900 release from 8 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting their boxes and dock floor in a 3' x 3' due to loose lids on the jugs. A total of 32 bottles were found damaged and containerized into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon vented poly drums. Absorbent pads were utilized to clean the released product. The impacted rags, cardboard, and cleanup debris were then placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070404
item.description:
Report X-2023070404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE LOAD WALL ON THE IRREG BELT. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE AND PLACED IT IN A SPILL TRAY FOR TRANSPORT TO DMP AREA. TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023070387
item.description:
Report X-2023070387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO CALL OF A 5 GALLON METAL BUCKET. THE BUCKET WAS DENTED ON THE LID AND LEAKED, THERE WAS NO OUTER PACKING. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO, TRANSPORTED AND PROCESSED THE PACKAGE WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE.

item.title: Report X-2023080058
item.description:
Report X-2023080058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: PRESCOTT
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when found to be wet. line was stopped, package was placed in lined haz tote and isolated in hazmat cage. DescribePack: appears that lids were loose and had slight leak. all internal cans had "dented/crushed" bottoms. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pakcage was ioslated in lined hazmat tote and taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023071167
item.description:
Report X-2023071167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the south unload leaking and was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA to be processed. DescribePack: 2 Bottles were crushed together which caused liquid to leak out and damaged the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat bag was placed into a white pail and into the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023070312
item.description:
Report X-2023070312

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE CALL IN THE UNLOAD WEARING PPE AND UTILIZING DECISION TREE. WHILE RESPONDING TO THE PACKAGE RESPONDER OBSERVED A 5GAL PLASTIC INNER CONTAINER LABELLED FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3, UN1219, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, CONTACTED HMSC TO CONFIRM UNDECLARED. THE INNER CONTAINER WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE WERE NO INNER PACKAGING AND LABELS ON THE OUTER CARTON.

item.title: Report E-2023070908
item.description:
Report E-2023070908

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 50 pound bags of phycomycin (UN3378) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 pounds of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
